clinical_study.brief_title: FORWARD PRO Study Interventional Post-market Study With the Evolut™ PRO System
clinical_study.official_title: FORWARD PRO Study Interventional Post-market Study With the Evolut™ PRO System

brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective, single-arm, multi-center, interventional post-market study. After signing informed consent, eligible subjects will be implanted with the CE marked Evolut™ PRO system.
The investigation purpose is to evaluate the acute and long term clinical performance and safety of Evolut™ PRO in a routine hospital setting in patients with symptomatic native aortic valve stenosis or a stenosed, insufficient, or combined surgical bioprosthetic valve failure necessitating valve replacement within the approved intended use in local geography.

detailed_description.textblock: Approximately 600 subjects implanted with the Evolut™ PRO at up to 40 sites in Europe. Other regions may be added depending on the regulatory status of the device.

primary_outcome.description: The all-cause mortality rate at 30 days post procedure meets a prespecified performance goal of 5.5%.

secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects graded as none or trace total aortic regurgitation at discharge is greater than a prespecified performance goal of 67.1%.

Event rate of the VARC-2 composite safety endpoint at 30 days post procedure, which includes the following components: All-cause mortality All stroke (disabling and non-disabling) Life-threatening bleeding Acute kidney injury: stage 2 or 3 (including renal replacement therapy) Coronary artery obstruction requiring intervention Major vascular complication Valve-related dysfunction requiring repeat procedure (BAV, TAVI, or SAVR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Individual components of the VARC-2 composite safety endpoint
secondary_outcome.description: Event rates of the individual components of the VARC-2 composite safety endpoint at 30 days post procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of new permanent pacemaker implant
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of new permanent pacemaker implant at 30 days post procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours to 7 days post procedure (prior to discharge)
secondary_outcome.description: Device success rate at 24 hours to 7 days post procedure (prior to discharge), defined according to the VARC-2 guidelines as: Absence of procedural mortality, AND Correct positioning of a single prosthetic heart valve into the proper anatomical location, AND Intended performance of the prosthetic heart valve, defined as the absence of patient prosthesis mismatch and mean gradient <20 mmHg (or peak velocity <3 m/sec), AND No moderate or severe prosthetic valve regurgitation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours to 7 days (prior to discharge), 1-year, 3-year and 5-year post
secondary_outcome.description: Hemodynamic performance at 24 hours to 7 days (prior to discharge), 1-year, 3-year and 5-year post procedure, including the mean prosthetic valve gradient as measured by transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) and assessed by an independent core laboratory.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours to 7 days (prior to discharge), 1-year, 3-year and 5-year post
secondary_outcome.description: Hemodynamic performance at 24 hours to 7 days (prior to discharge), 1-year, 3-year and 5-year post procedure, including the effective orifice area as measured by transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) and assessed by an independent core laboratory.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours to 7 days (prior to discharge), 1-year, 3-year and 5-year post
secondary_outcome.description: Hemodynamic performance at 24 hours to 7 days (prior to discharge), 1-year, 3-year and 5-year post procedure, including the degree of prosthetic valve regurgitation (transvalvular, paravalvular, and total) as measured by transthoracic echocardiography (TTE) and assessed by an independent core laboratory.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 30-day, 1-year, 3-year, and 5-year post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in NYHA functional status from baseline to 30-day, 1-year, 3-year, and 5-year post procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of Life score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 30-day, and 1-year, 3-year, and 5-year post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Quality of Life score (EQ-5D questionnaire) from baseline to 30-day, and 1-year, 3-year, and 5-year post procedure. The EQ-5D descriptive system comprises five dimensions and each dimension has five levels of severity. The subject is asked to indicate his/her health state by ticking (or placing a cross) in the box against the most appropriate statement in each of the five dimensions. The EQ VAS records the subject's self-rated health on a 20 cm vertical, visual analogue scale. The subject marks an X on the scale to indicate how his/her health is TODAY and then writes the number they marked on the scale in the box below.

intervention.intervention_name: Medtronic CoreValve™ Evolut™ PRO System (Evolut™ PRO System)
intervention.description: Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement with Medtronic Evolut PRO system

study_pop.textblock: Patients with symptomatic native aortic valve stenosis or a stenosed, insufficient, or combined surgical bioprosthetic valve failure necessitating valve replacement within the approved intended use in local geography.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Symptomatic native aortic valve stenosis or a stenosed, insufficient, or combined surgical bioprosthetic valve failure necessitating valve replacement
- High or greater risk for surgical aortic valve replacement as estimated by the heart team OR, 75 years or older and at intermediate risk for surgical AVR (STS risk score ≥4% or with an estimated hospital mortality ≥4% as assessed by the heart team)
- Acceptable candidate for treatment with the Evolut™ PRO system in conformity with the Instructions for Use and the local regulations
- Able and willing to return to the implanting site at the following follow-up visits: 1-year, 3-year and 5-year
- Written informed consent obtained without assistance from a legal representative prior to enrollment in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity or contraindication to aspirin, heparin (HIT/HITTS) and bivalirudin, ticlopidine, clopidogrel, Nitinol (Titanium or Nickel), or sensitivity to contrast media, which cannot be adequately premedicated
- Preexisting mechanical heart valve in aortic position
- Ongoing sepsis, including active endocarditis
- Anatomically not suitable for the Evolut™ PRO system
- Estimated life expectancy of less than 1 year
- Participating in another trial that may influence the outcome of this study
- Need for emergency surgery for any reason
- Inability to understand and respond to the quality of life questionnaire
